newsitem.title: RUSSIA: New Surgutneftegaz shares will not reach market.
newsitem.headline: New Surgutneftegaz shares will not reach market.

text.p: A new issue of shares in OAO Surgutneftegaz will not reach the secondary market, a senior official at majority shareholder Surgut Holding (NK Surgutneftegaz) said on Friday.

"These shares are necessary for (Surgut Holding) to strengthen controls over its subsidiary. They are not intended to be converted into shares of subsidiaries or for ADR issues," Andrei Serebryakov, acting head of Surgut Holding's securities department, told Reuters.

Surgut Holding said on Thursday it had acquired an entire new issue of Surgutneftegaz shares, which raised its paid-in capital by 534 billion roubles to 5.998 trillion roubles, or 5.998 billion shares.
The move takes Surgut Holding's stake in Surgutneftegaz to about 43.5 percent from 38 percent.
"We intended to strengthen our control because some of the shares belonging to employees of Surgutneftegaz have already been sold," Serebryakov said.
"At the same time, some decisions require a much bigger stake than 38 percent or 51 percent of the voting shares. We need three quarters of the votes."

The new issue was not related to plans to issue level-one American Depositary Receipts later this year or early next year, he said. The company would discuss these plans with Bank of New York next month, he said.
Surgutneftegaz shares fell sharply on news of the issue on fears of increased supply, and concerns by existing shareholders that their stakes would be diluted.
Surgutneftegaz preferred fell on Thursday to $0.232 from $0.290 on Wednesday, and ordinaries fell to $0.425 from $0.462. At 1030 GMT Surgutneftegaz preferred were at $0.221 and ordinaries at $0.416.
